User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user in the CareerPilot AI platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

authProvider.description: The authentication provider used by the user (e.g., Google, GitHub).

lastLogin.description: Timestamp of the user's last login.

Resume.title: Resume
Resume.description: Represents a user's resume stored in the system.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Resume entity.

filename.description: The original filename of the uploaded resume.

uploadDate.description: Timestamp of when the resume was uploaded.

resumeText.description: The extracted text content of the resume.

ResumeAnalysis.title: ResumeAnalysis
ResumeAnalysis.description: Represents the AI analysis results for a resume.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ResumeAnalysis entity.

atsScore.description: The AI-generated Applicant Tracking System (ATS) score (0-100).

improvementSuggestions.description: AI-generated suggestions for improving the resume.

analysisDate.description: Timestamp of when the resume analysis was performed.

InterviewSession.title: InterviewSession
InterviewSession.description: Represents a mock interview session conducted by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the InterviewSession entity.

jobRole.description: The job role selected for the mock interview (e.g., Software Engineer).

interviewDate.description: Timestamp of when the interview session was started.

InterviewAnswer.title: InterviewAnswer
InterviewAnswer.description: Represents a user's answer to a specific interview question.

id.description: Unique identifier for the InterviewAnswer entity.

answer.description: The user's answer to the interview question.

modelAnswer.description: AI-generated model answer for the question.

SkillGapAnalysis.title: SkillGapAnalysis
SkillGapAnalysis.description: Represents the skill gap analysis results for a user and a specific job role.

id.description: Unique identifier for the SkillGapAnalysis entity.

jobRole.description: The job role used for the skill gap analysis.

missingSkills.description: Identified missing skills based on resume and job role requirements.

learningRoadmap.description: Personalized learning roadmap with recommended resources.

analysisDate.description: Timestamp of when the skill gap analysis was performed.

JobDescriptionAnalysis.title: JobDescriptionAnalysis
JobDescriptionAnalysis.description: Represents the analysis results for a job description.

id.description: Unique identifier for the JobDescriptionAnalysis entity.

jobDescriptionText.description: The text content of the job description.

requiredSkills.description: Extracted required skills from the job description.

experienceLevel.description: Extracted experience level from the job description.

keywords.description: Extracted keywords from the job description.

resumeMatchPercentage.description: The percentage of resume keywords matched with the job description.

missingKeywords.description: Keywords missing from the resume compared to the job description.

analysisDate.description: Timestamp of when the job description analysis was performed.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed to ensure security, scalability, and ease of debugging, while adhering to the principles of Authorization Independence, Clarity of Intent, DBAC (Database-Based Access Control), and QAPs (Rules are not Filters). Authorization Independence is achieved by denormalizing authorization-related data (like user IDs for ownership) into subcollections when needed, avoiding `get()` calls in security rules. Structural Segregation is implemented by keeping data with different access requirements in separate collections. Access Modeling follows a path-based ownership model (e.g., `/users/{userId}/resumes/{resumeId}`) for private user data and nested data, ensuring simple and efficient security rules. This design also prioritizes Data Clarity and Predictability by using explicit state modeling with the `status` field (although the entities provided didn't have it, is a good practice), and enforcing strict naming conventions. This structure facilitates simple, robust, and easily debuggable security rules, supporting secure `list` operations via structural segregation. The design avoids custom claims and relies solely on `request.auth.uid` for authorization, which is crucial for simplicity and security.
